Access to projects

Damiano Oldoni

2018-05-31

Source: vignettes/Access-to-projects.Rmd
Access-to-projects.Rmd

Many functions of the etn package accept project-related parameters like animal_project and network_project. In the ETN database there are two fields to identify a project called projectcode and projectname:

library(etn)
my_con <- connect_to_etn(Sys.getenv("userid"),
                         Sys.getenv("pwd"))
projects <- get_animals(my_con)
grep("project", colnames(projects), value=TRUE) # print projects*** columns
#> [1] "projectname"   "projectmember" "project_fk"    "projectcode"

So, which one should you use it? The answer is: projectcode.

With an animal project:

library(dplyr)
animals <- get_animals(my_con, animal_project = "2012_leopoldkanaal")
animals %>% distinct(projectcode) %>% pull()
#> [1] "2012_leopoldkanaal"
animals %>% distinct(projectname) %>% pull()
#> [1] "2012 Leopoldkanaal"

With a network project:

animals <- get_animals(my_con, network_project = "thornton")
animals %>% distinct(projectcode) %>% pull()
#>  [1] "2015_fint"          "2013_albertkanaal"  "phd_reubens"       
#>  [4] "2011_rivierprik"    "2012_leopoldkanaal" "2015_phd_verhelst" 
#>  [7] "rangetest"          "2014_demer"         "homarus"           
#> [10] "2015_dijle"
animals %>% distinct(projectname) %>% pull()
#>  [1] "2015 Fint"          "2013 Albertkanaal"  "PhD Jan Reubens"   
#>  [4] "2011 Rivierprik"    "2012 Leopoldkanaal" "2015 PhD Verhelst" 
#>  [7] "rangetest"          "2014 Demer"         "Homarus"           
#> [10] "2015 Dijle"

The are many reasons for using the code of a project instead of its name. Project codes are typically shorter, therefore faster to write, while project names are longer and more informative. The presence of spaces in the project names can also easily lead to mistyping errors.

How to find a project code

What if you have no clue about the project code you interested to?

Run get_projects():

get_projects(my_con) %>% select(name, projectcode)
name projectcode
Lifewatch cpod-lifewatch
Lifewatch lifewatch
Noordzeekanaal Noordzeekanaal
PC4C pc4c
Deveron 2016 Deveron
Moray Firth 2016 MorayFirth
Aberdeen 2017 Aberdeen
Conon 2017 Conon
Skye 2017 Skye
Homarus homarus

Finally, please notice that neither project names nor project codes are unique as shown in the case of project "ARAISOLA01":

get_projects(my_con) %>%
  filter(name == "ARAISOLA01") %>%
  knitr::kable()
id name projectcode type startdate enddate moratorium imis_dataset_id latitude longitude
646 ARAISOLA01 ARAISOLA01 animal 2004-03-01 2004-06-30 0 5930 38.213 13.23539
650 ARAISOLA01 ARAISOLA01 network 2004-03-01 2004-06-30 0 5930 38.213 13.23539
